intro: Randia brevituba, commonly known as the short-stemmed randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round berries that contain the seeds. Randia brevituba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
